DOC.brief_summary: This clinical study compare conventional surgical technique ( CST ) minimally invasive surgical technique ( MIST ) regenerative treatment mandibular furcation defect .
DOC.brief_title: Conventional Minimally Invasive Surgical Technique Treatment Furcation Defects Using Enamel Matrix Derivative Anorganic Bovine Bone - Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial .
DOC.detailed_description: Using split-mouth design , fifteen patient bilateral class II III furcation defect treat MIST ( Test Group ) CST ( Control Group ) . Furcation defect group fill anorganic bovine bone ( ABB ) enamel matrix derivative ( EMD ) . Patient-centered outcome include analysis pain , discomfort , edema , hematoma , root hypersensitivity daily activity interference record use Visual Analogue Scale seven day surgery . Clinical radiographic parameter assess baseline 6 month postoperatively . Data statistically analyse .
DOC.criteria: ( I ) subject diagnosis periodontitis ; ( II ) presence one pair contralateral mandibular molar buccal / lingual furcation defect ; ( III ) nonsmoker ; ( IV ) plaque index < 20 % . ( I ) patient present systemic disease ; ( II ) take antibiotic past 6 month prior surgery ; ( III ) pregnant woman lactate mother ; ( IV ) molars periapical disease ; ( V ) cervical restoration prosthesis close 1 mm fornix ; ( VI ) lingual furcation defect present gingival recession ( GR )
